thread.title: San Jose State's upset bid at Auburn falls short
thread.title_full: San Jose State's upset bid at Auburn falls short

author:
Sam Butler

Correspondent
title: San Jose State's upset bid at Auburn falls short
text:
San Jose State's upset bid at Auburn falls short By Sam Butler Posted: 10/03/2015 04:14:12 PM PDT Updated: 10/03/2015 04:14:14 PM PDT Despite substantially outgaining the Auburn Tigers, San Jose State couldn't get out of its own way when it mattered, coughing up two fumbles and throwing a pair of interceptions in a 35-21 loss on a chilly, rainy day in Auburn on Saturday. 
The Spartans fell to these same Tigers 59-13 last year. 
The Spartans consistently gave Auburn a short field, if not turnovers, then by special teams breakdowns. The Tigers returned a pair of kickoffs deep into San Jose State territory, giving their struggling offense an easier distance to work with. 
Quarterback Joe Gray finished 21 for 33 with 224 yards and a touchdown. He threw two interceptions, including a key play in the first quarter when Auburn linebacker Justin Garrett caught the ball after it was deflected by cornerback Blake Countess, and the Tigers punched in the first of four touchdowns by running back Peyton Barber soon after, putting San Jose State in a hole they weren't able to climb out of. 
Tailback Tyler Ervin, fresh off his 300-yard game against Fresno State last week, rushed for 160 yards, but he fumbled once on a 4th down dive that was recovered by Auburn. He collected a 2-yard touchdown with just under 5 minutes left, which pulled the Spartans within 28-21. Advertisement
